Package org.example.unogame.model.machine

Class ThreadPlayMachine

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
org.example.unogame.model.machine.ThreadPlayMachine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Runnable
public class ThreadPlayMachine extends Thread implements Serializable
Background thread that automates the machine player's turns.

When it is not the human's turn, this thread attempts to play a valid card from the machine hand; if none is available, it draws one card. It updates the table image and triggers UI animations on the JavaFX thread.

Threading

  • UI updates are wrapped in Platform.runLater(Runnable).
  • The loop exits when setRunning(boolean) is called with false or when the thread is interrupted during sleep.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ThreadPlayMachine

      public ThreadPlayMachine(Table table, Player machinePlayer, javafx.scene.image.ImageView tableImageView, GameUnoController controller, Deck deck)
      Creates a machine-play thread bound to the current table, machine player, and UI.
      Parameters:
      table - the shared table state (top card, discards)
      machinePlayer - the machine player instance
      tableImageView - image view displaying the top card on the table
      controller - controller used to query rules and flip turns
      deck - the shared deck used to draw when needed

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Main loop: when it is not the human's turn, wait briefly to simulate thinking, attempt to play a card, otherwise draw, then refresh the UI.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

    • getRandomColorFromHand

      public String getRandomColorFromHand()
      Picks a random Uno color (uniformly) without considering the machine's current hand. This is a simple heuristic placeholder.
      Returns:
      one of "RED", "BLUE", "YELLOW", or "GREEN"

    • setRunning

      public void setRunning(boolean running)
      Starts or stops the main loop of this thread.
      Parameters:
      running - true to continue running; false to request stop
